tasks.title: Setup Project Repository and Initial Structure
tasks.description: Initialize a new project repository with a basic structure for a static one-page website using HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript (ES6+).
tasks.details: Create a new repository on GitHub or similar platform. Set up the following directory structure: /index.html, /css/style.css, /js/script.js, /images/. Initialize with a basic HTML5 template. Use modern tooling like Vite (v5.x) for fast development and hot reloading, or stick to vanilla JS if preferred. Add a .gitignore file to exclude node_modules and other unnecessary files.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify repository creation and directory structure. Test initial HTML template loads in browser.

tasks.title: Design and Implement Responsive Layout
tasks.description: Design and implement a responsive layout for the one-page website, ensuring compatibility with mobile and desktop devices.
tasks.details: Use CSS Grid and Flexbox for layout. Implement a mobile-first approach. Use media queries to adapt layout for different screen sizes. Choose a clean, modern sans-serif font (e.g., 'Inter', 'Roboto', or 'Open Sans'). Apply color scheme: beige/cream background, dark text, orange accents for buttons and highlights. Ensure all sections are visually distinct but cohesive. Use CSS variables for easy theme management.
tasks.testStrategy: Test layout on multiple devices and screen sizes using browser developer tools and real devices. Check for visual consistency and readability.

tasks.title: Implement Hero Section with CTA
tasks.description: Create the Hero section with a catchy headline, brief description, and a call-to-action button that scrolls to the tools section.
tasks.details: Add a Hero section at the top of the page. Include a headline (e.g., 'Potrzebne narzędzia? Pożycz od sąsiada!'), a short description of the initiative, and a CTA button ('Zobacz dostępne narzędzia'). Style the background with a relevant image or illustration (tools, wood). Use JavaScript to implement smooth scrolling to the tools section when the CTA is clicked.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify Hero section displays correctly. Test CTA button scrolls smoothly to the tools section.

tasks.title: Build 'Why Us?' Section with Icon Tiles
tasks.description: Implement the 'Why Us?' section with four icon tiles, each highlighting a benefit of using the tool rental service.
tasks.details: Create a section with four tiles, each containing an icon and a short description: 'Szeroki Wybór', 'Dostępne Ceny', 'Wygodny Dostęp', 'Gwarancja Jakości'. Use SVG icons for scalability. Style tiles to match the color scheme. Ensure responsive behavior.
tasks.testStrategy: Check that all four tiles display correctly on all devices. Verify icons and text are legible and aligned.

tasks.title: Develop Tools Section with Dynamic Content
tasks.description: Implement the tools section, allowing easy addition/removal of tools via a simple JavaScript object array.
tasks.details: Create a tools section that displays a list of tools (initially: Wiertarka udarowa, Betoniarka, Piła ukośnica). Store tool data in a JavaScript array of objects in script.js (e.g., [{name: 'Wiertarka udarowa', description: '...', image: '...'}, ...]). Use JavaScript to dynamically render tools from this array. Ensure new tools can be added or removed by editing only this array, without changing HTML structure.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify tools are displayed from the array. Test adding/removing tools by editing the array and checking the page updates.

subtasks.title: Define JavaScript Object Array for Tools
subtasks.description: Create a JavaScript array where each element is an object representing a tool, including properties such as name, description, and any relevant metadata.
subtasks.details: Ensure the array is structured for easy iteration and manipulation, following best practices for object arrays in JavaScript.

subtasks.title: Render Tool List Dynamically
subtasks.description: Implement logic to iterate over the tools array and generate corresponding DOM elements for each tool, displaying them on the page.
subtasks.details: Use JavaScript to create and insert elements into the DOM based on the current state of the tools array.

subtasks.title: Style Tool Cards
subtasks.description: Apply CSS styles to the rendered tool elements to present them as visually distinct cards.
subtasks.details: Ensure the cards are responsive and visually appealing, using classes or inline styles as appropriate.

subtasks.title: Implement Add/Remove Logic
subtasks.description: Add JavaScript functions to allow users to add new tools to the array and remove existing ones, updating the rendered list accordingly.
subtasks.details: Ensure that the UI updates in real time as tools are added or removed from the array.

subtasks.title: Test Dynamic Updates
subtasks.description: Verify that adding and removing tools updates both the data array and the rendered UI correctly, and handle any edge cases.
subtasks.details: Test with various scenarios, such as adding duplicate tools or removing all tools, to ensure robustness.

tasks.title: Create Contact and Location Section
tasks.description: Implement the contact and location section with contact details and an interactive Google Maps embed.
tasks.details: Add a section with contact information (phone, email). Embed an interactive Google Maps iframe for location. Style to match the site's design. Ensure the map is responsive and loads efficiently.
tasks.testStrategy: Check contact details are correct and visible. Test Google Maps embed loads and is responsive on all devices.

tasks.title: Optimize Performance and Accessibility
tasks.description: Optimize the website for fast loading, accessibility, and cross-browser compatibility.
tasks.details: Optimize images (use WebP/AVIF formats). Implement lazy loading for images and iframes. Add alt text for images. Ensure color contrast meets accessibility standards. Test on multiple browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge). Use modern CSS and JS features with fallbacks for older browsers.
tasks.testStrategy: Test page load speed (Lighthouse). Check accessibility with tools like axe or WAVE. Verify cross-browser compatibility.

subtasks.title: Optimize Images Using WebP/AVIF
subtasks.description: Convert existing images to modern formats like WebP and AVIF to reduce file size and improve loading speed without sacrificing quality.
subtasks.details: Identify all images used on the site. Use tools or scripts to convert images to WebP and AVIF formats. Update image references in the code to use these optimized formats, leveraging the <picture> element and srcset for responsive delivery.

subtasks.title: Implement Lazy Loading for Images
subtasks.description: Defer the loading of images that are not immediately visible in the viewport to improve initial page load performance.
subtasks.details: Use the native loading="lazy" attribute for images where supported, and implement a JavaScript-based lazy loading solution (e.g., using Intersection Observer API) for broader compatibility. Ensure all image tags are updated accordingly.

subtasks.title: Add Alt Text and ARIA Attributes
subtasks.description: Ensure all images have descriptive alt text and add appropriate ARIA attributes to enhance accessibility for users with assistive technologies.
subtasks.details: Review all image elements and provide meaningful alt text. For complex images or interactive elements, add ARIA roles and labels as needed to meet WCAG 2.1 accessibility standards.

subtasks.title: Check Color Contrast and Accessibility
subtasks.description: Evaluate the website's color contrast and overall accessibility to ensure compliance with accessibility guidelines.
subtasks.details: Use tools like WAVE, aXe, or Lighthouse to audit color contrast ratios (minimum 4.5:1 for normal text) and other accessibility issues. Adjust CSS and markup as needed to resolve any identified problems.

subtasks.title: Test Cross-Browser Compatibility
subtasks.description: Verify that all optimizations and accessibility improvements work consistently across major browsers and devices.
subtasks.details: Use tools such as BrowserStack or LambdaTest to test the site in Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, and on mobile devices. Check for layout, image format support, and accessibility issues.

subtasks.title: Add Fallbacks for Older Browsers
subtasks.description: Implement fallback solutions for browsers that do not support modern image formats or lazy loading features.
subtasks.details: Use the <picture> element to provide JPEG/PNG fallbacks for browsers that do not support WebP/AVIF. Add polyfills or alternative scripts for lazy loading and ARIA features where necessary. Test to ensure graceful degradation.

tasks.title: Final Review, Testing, and Deployment
tasks.description: Conduct a final review, comprehensive testing, and deploy the website.
tasks.details: Review all sections for consistency and functionality. Test all interactive elements (smooth scrolling, tool display, contact info, map). Deploy to a static hosting service (e.g., Netlify, Vercel, GitHub Pages). Ensure the site is publicly accessible and all links work.
tasks.testStrategy: Perform end-to-end testing on all devices. Check deployment and public accessibility. Verify all requirements from the PRD are met.

subtasks.title: Review All Sections for Consistency
subtasks.description: Examine every section of the project to ensure content, design, and functionality are consistent throughout. Identify and document any discrepancies or areas needing alignment.
subtasks.details: Check for uniformity in terminology, formatting, navigation, and visual elements. Confirm that all sections adhere to project guidelines and standards.

subtasks.title: Test All Interactive Elements
subtasks.description: Manually and/or automatically test all buttons, forms, links, and other interactive components to verify correct behavior and responsiveness.
subtasks.details: Ensure that all user interactions trigger the expected outcomes. Document any bugs or usability issues for resolution.

subtasks.title: Perform End-to-End Device/Browser Testing
subtasks.description: Conduct comprehensive end-to-end tests across multiple devices and browsers to validate the complete user experience and system integration.
subtasks.details: Use automated frameworks (e.g., Selenium, Cypress) and manual testing to simulate real user scenarios, ensuring compatibility and identifying cross-platform issues.

subtasks.title: Deploy to Chosen Hosting Platform
subtasks.description: Deploy the thoroughly tested project to the selected hosting environment, following best practices for configuration and security.
subtasks.details: Prepare deployment artifacts, configure environment variables, and execute the deployment process. Monitor for deployment errors.

subtasks.title: Verify Public Accessibility and Requirements
subtasks.description: Confirm that the deployed project is publicly accessible and meets all specified requirements, including performance, security, and compliance.
subtasks.details: Test access from different networks and devices, validate that all features function as intended, and ensure compliance with project specifications.
